title: The Subjunctive Mood
description: Master the subjunctive mood in Brazilian Portuguese

questions.prompt: Which sentence uses the present subjunctive correctly?
questions.explanation: After 'espero que' (I hope that), use the present subjunctive: 'venha' from 'vir'.

questions.prompt: Match the triggers with subjunctive usage
When do you use the subjunctive in Portuguese?
questions.explanation: The subjunctive expresses wishes, doubts, emotions, and hypothetical situations.

questions.prompt: Build: 'I want you to come' (Quero que você venha)
Write 'Although he is tired' in Portuguese
What is the past subjunctive of 'ser' (eu)?
questions.explanation: 'Fosse' is the past (imperfect) subjunctive of 'ser'. 'Seja' is present subjunctive.

content.text: The subjunctive is used after expressions of:

items: Quero que..., Desejo que..., Espero que...
Estou feliz que..., Sinto muito que...
É preciso que..., É necessário que...

content.text: Regular verbs - take the 'eu' present form, drop -o, add subjunctive endings:

items: Falar: fale, fale, fale, falemos, falem
Comer: coma, coma, coma, comamos, comam
Partir: parta, parta, parta, partamos, partam
Ser: seja, seja, seja, sejamos, sejam
Estar: esteja, esteja, esteja, estejamos, estejam
Ir: vá, vá, vá, vamos, vão
Ter: tenha, tenha, tenha, tenhamos, tenham

content.text: In Brazil, some speakers replace subjunctive with indicative in casual speech, but subjunctive is still correct and used in writing.
If the main clause and subordinate clause have the same subject, use the infinitive: 'Quero ir' (I want to go).
